name: Smoky Bear Campground & RV Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would def recommend thes camp site. It is about maybe 10 or so mins away from Gatlinburg which makes it great. It is close enough but you can avoid all the crazyness that can be closer to the towns. It is very clean and maintained. Almost all the sites are surrounded by beautiful trees. As we drove around it seemed the others were completly out in the open. I don't know, but I prefer to feel like I am in the woods if I'm going to go to a campground. The bathrooms and showers are also very clean. Loved it! Would recommend it over any other campground.
reviews.title: Beautiful , serene camp site

reviews.text: The Smoky Bear Campground was a wonderful experience and we would highly recommend it for anyone vacationing in the Great Smoky Mountian National Park area. Conveniently located east of Gatlinburg, it is with a stones throw of the national park.
reviews.title: Best Camping Experience Ever!

reviews.text: Your hosts for your experience are Barry and Chong, wonderful people with positive attitudes that ensure your stay is everything you would hope it would be. Barry is an wonderful host, helping out with any situations that may arise, he gladly will help you back into your site and give you his expertise on any situation that may arise. He is a fifth wheel camper but his experience is not limited to fifth wheels, he also knows much about motor homes and other type of recreational vehicles. Chong is a delight and she is the spirit of the positive experience we had on their property. She walks through the campground several times a day and greets her guests by name and will offer suggestions on places to visit and the sights to see around the campground.
reviews.title: A little piece of heaven in the Smokies

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in Mama Bear Cabin and it was a perfect place nestled under the trees, with easy acces to the office and bathrooms. Our cabin was clean and neat and there was plenty of room for a party of two. Although our cabin had an ample size bathroom and shower we checked out their bath house facilities and they were spotless! Our friends stayed in lot 40, right next door to our cabin, this is a great spot with plenty of room for a fifth wheel.
reviews.title: A+++ Experience-Highly Recommend this campground

reviews.text: The wonderful reviews you read regarding this little slice of heaven are all true and we just can't say enough about the Smoky Bear Campground! Try it, you will love it, it is Fantastic!
reviews.title: They should have a 6 Star rating for this RV park & campground

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay ! The area is beautiful, well kept, and the bath facilities exceptionally clean and nice. The owners are super, and we really enjoyed our 2 week stay. Chong and Barry made you feel welcome and like part of a big family instead of only a customer. We will definitely stay here again and again!!! Recommend
reviews.title: Best Campground Around !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: to anyone looking for a super clean, quiet place with all the basic ammenites and more.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We love this little campground! It's like home when we visit the Smokies. We've camped at most of the other campgrounds in Gatlinburg and now we call this one home. You are treated like family the minute you enter the grounds. Clean doesn't begin to describe the facilities. You can tell that the owners really care and we always look forward to see what they've done since we were last here. Our lab loves it here too! It's hard to choose which season we like best and there is so much to do, but it is also nice to hang out in our RV, sit by the fire and relax.
reviews.title: Couldn't be better

reviews.text: This campground is adorable and clean, clean, clean. The owners are super friendly and helpful. My husband and I are new with our travel trailer and the owner himself helped us back it in. The rest rooms are immaculate, well stocked with paper products and beautifully decorated. It's a little bit outside of Gatlinburg, but there's a great apple orchard just down the road that sells awesome apple cider in the fall. We loved this campground and will visit again.
reviews.title: Very clean campground, priced reasonable

likes.disliked: — No exceptions on this campground, exellent services

reviews.text: We booked 3 nights at this campground. It was a bit out of town which is what I wanted to be out of the rat race at night. The campground is very well kept, the owners are friendly and made sure things were very comfortable for us. The bathrooms are exceptionally clean as is the camp itself. Would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: very nice campground

reviews.text: There are only 2 cabins at this campground but we loved the cabin. It was clean and adorable. It included a bed, small bathroom, a refrigerator and a tv. The bathhouse in the campground was very clean, spotless. We would definintely stay here again.
reviews.title: loved the cabin
not so great
reviews.text: We recently stayed for 5 days in a parked Trailer (provided by Smoky Bear Campground) - rental was somewhere around $50 a day just before the Labor Day weekend. The price was decent for the trailer. However, the trailer itself was dirty (especially behind the sofa). The location of the trailer was not at all wooded, which is what we were thinking by seeing the pictures. The trailer was very narrow inside (this was our first experience in a trailer), though the space was sufficient for 2 people, not looking for too much luxurious space.

Clean, updated and friendly. We were welcomed with open arms. Facilities were clean. Had all the amenities we wanted. WiFi service was not reliable at our spot. Our site was also a bit narrow causing some difficulty getting in and being able to set up our awning.
reviews.title: Great family friendly campground

reviews.text: Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend the Smoky Bear to others.
reviews.title: Small campground that's big on hospitality

reviews.text: I searched several websites before deciding to take a chance on Smoky Bear Campground. This was our first "camping trip" to the Smokies and we brought our 10 year old granddaughter and her friend for a week long vacation. My husband and I loved the campground. Sites were not crowded and all were shady and extremely well maintained.
reviews.title: Second Stay and will Always Return

reviews.text: Not surprised it has a 5 Star from Good Sam. Hope to return again to the Great Smokies and will definitely camp at Smoky Bear.
reviews.title: Nice campground, exceptionally clean!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: We loved it and will come back with the kids

aka: Smoky Bear Campground And Rv Park
